captions.text: BOMB SQUAD!

Man: ARE WE LOOKING AT THE NEXT
AMERICAN HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION?
OH, WHAT A SHOT!
MY TIME IS NOW, BABY.
I'M 32-0 WITH 32 KNOCKOUTS.

WHEN YOU TALK ABOUT
THE HEAVYWEIGHT DIVISION,
YOU CANNOT SPEAK ABOUT IT

WITHOUT SPEAKING ABOUT
DEONTAY WILDER'S NAME.

Narrator: DEONTAY WILDER SEEMS
THAT RAREST OF BIG MEN --
LETHAL AND LEAN.
A 6'7", 230-POUND AMALGAM

OF POWER, ATHLETICISM,
AND CHARISMA.

Wilder:
THE THINGS THAT I DO,

A CHARACTER INSIDE AND OUTSIDE
OF THE RING --

THAT'S WHAT
THEY'VE BEEN YEARNING FOR.

THEY'VE BEEN LOOKING FOR
AN EXCITING HEAVYWEIGHT.
Man: DOWN HE GOES!

Wilder:
AND NOW THEY HAVE FOUND THAT.
I'M THE MAN TO RECKON WITH.

STIVERNE, YOU WATCH OUT,
'CAUSE I'M COMING, BABY.

Narrator: WHAT WILDER
DOESN'T HAVE IS A TITLE.

THAT HE'LL HAVE TO TAKE FROM
A RUGGED AND DANGEROUS CHAMPION

MORE FORMIDABLE THAN ANYONE
HE'S EVER FACED.

IN HIS MIND, HE THINKS
IT'S A JOKE OR SOMETHING.
I DON'T SEE IT LIKE THAT.

Narrator:
BERMANE STIVERNE BELIEVES

HE'S THE FUTURE OF
THE HEAVYWEIGHT DIVISION.

AND WHILE HE'S NOT GIVEN
TO ANTIC EXPRESSION,

HE'LL BE THE ONE POSING
THE QUESTIONS JANUARY 17th.

IS WILDER A FIGHTER
OR MERELY AN ATHLETE?

A FAMILIAR FORM OF COUNTERFEIT
OR THE HERALD OF A NEW AGE?
THIS IS JUDGMENT DAY FOR HIM.
[ BIRDS CHIRPING ]
[ WILDER HUMMING ]

♪ VICTORY, VICTORY
SHALL BE MINE ♪
♪ OH, VICTORY ♪
♪ VICTORY SHALL BE MINE ♪
♪ IF I HOLD MY PEACE ♪
♪ VICTORY SHALL BE MINE ♪

Narrator: IF DEONTAY WILDER
SEEMS CONFIDENT,

IT'S BECAUSE NONE
OF HIS OPPONENTS

HAVE SURVIVED
BEYOND THE FOURTH ROUND.

STILL, CRITICS HAVE QUESTIONED
THE CALIBER OF OPPOSITION

IN ACCUMULATING
HIS PERFECT 32-0 RECORD.

Wilder: A LOT OF THEM ARE
IMPRESSED BY THE KNOCKOUTS,

BUT THERE'S CERTAIN THINGS
THAT THEY WANT TO SEE FROM ME

AND CERTAIN OPPONENTS
THAT THEY WANT TO SEE.

AND I THINK THIS IS GONNA BE AN
ICEBREAKER FOR A LOT OF PEOPLE.
[ HIP-HOP MUSIC PLAYS ]

PLAY MY THEME-SONG MUSIC
WHEN WE RIDE.
♪ BANK ON DEONTAY WILDER ♪
♪ ALI ♪
♪ LENNOX LEWIS ♪

♪ I BE BRINGING BOMB SQUAD,
BOMB SQUAD, BOMB SQUAD ♪

♪ BOMB SQUAD, BOMB SQUAD,
BOMB SQUAD ♪
♪ MAKE THEM BURN ♪

♪ WHEN WE CATCH YOU,
WE GONNA LINE YOUR...UP ♪
♪ WE TAKE 'EM OUT ♪

A LOT OF HEAVYWEIGHTS
ARE JEALOUS OF ME,

AND THEY SAY DIFFERENT THINGS
ABOUT ME

BECAUSE THEY CAN'T AND THEY'RE
NOT DOING WHAT I'M DOING.
I'M A TRUE ATHLETE.

I'M THE TYPE OF PERSON THAT
IF YOU SHOW ME HOW TO DO IT,
I CAN DO IT.
♪ WIRED UP, WIRED UP ♪

Deas: DEONTAY WALKED IN THE DOOR
IN LATE 2005,

AND HE TOLD ME HE WANTED TO BOX,
BUT I HEAR THAT ALL THE TIME.

HE WAS A LATE ARRIVER
TO THE SPORT.

MOST GUYS START AT ANYWHERE
FROM 8 TO 12 YEARS OLD.
DEONTAY STARTED AT ALMOST 20.
BUT WITHIN TWO MONTHS,

WE HAD ALREADY HAD HIM SPARRING
PROFESSIONAL BOXERS.

Wilder: AND I REMEMBER
MY FIRST TIME SPARRING A PRO.

I DROPPED HIM.
I DROPPED HIM ON THE CANVAS.
AAH!
STOP, STOP, STOP.

I REMEMBER HIM GOING DOWN,
AND MY EYES GOT SO BIG.
Man: TIME! [ CLAPS ]

THE GUY LOOKS OVER AT ME
AND HE SAYS,
"WHATEVER YOU DO, KEEP HIM."

IT'S A MATTER
OF TECHNIQUE.

YOU KNEW, ONCE YOU HIT HIM,
HE'S COMING LEFT HOOK,

AND YOU SAW IT, DIDN'T YOU?
THAT'S GOOD.
HAVE YOU EVER BEEN IN A PLACE

WHERE YOU KNEW YOU WAS AT THE
RIGHT PLACE AT THE RIGHT TIME?
ALMOST LIKE A ♪ HALLELUJAH ♪

LIKE A "HALLELUJAH" MOMENT,
MAN, I SWEAR.

AND I FEEL LIKE IT WAS MY LAST
OPPORTUNITY TO BECOME SOMEBODY.

Deas: PICK YOUR SPOTS.
PICK YOUR SPOTS.

Narrator:
WILDER'S NATURAL ATHLETICISM
LED TO A RAPID RISE,

WINNING A BRONZE MEDAL
IN THE BEIJING OLYMPICS,
BEFORE TURNING PRO IN 2008.
RIGHT HAND UP.

IT WAS THEN THAT DEAS RECRUITED
ANOTHER OLYMPIAN,
MARK BRELAND,

A FORMER GOLD MEDALIST
AND WELTERWEIGHT CHAMP,
TO HELP TRAIN WILDER.

NOW THEIR CHARGE IS CONSIDERED
AMERICA'S BEST HOPE

TO RECLAIM
THE HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE.
A CAMERA-READY STAR

EAGER TO GIVE THE DIVISION
WHAT IT'S BEEN MISSING.
I'M NOT SCARED TO TALK.

I'M NOT SCARED,
BECAUSE I'M GONNA BACK IT UP.
♪ DO, DO-DO, DO, DO ♪
[ LAUGHTER ]

OBTAIN GLORY AND THEN TO SAY
THEM WORDS, THREE WORDS --
"AND THE NEW..."
THERE YOU GO.

I'M COMING WITH 110%
OF ALABAMA POWER, BABY.

♪ I'M GONNA WHUP
SOMEBODY'S... ♪
[ LAUGHTER ]
HEY!

I KNOW HE'S TALKING,
TALKING A LOT OF SMACK,
DOING A LOT OF TRASH TALK.

WELL, TRASH BELONGS
IN THE TRASH.

Narrator: IF WILDER'S
PERSISTENT TAUNTING

IS MEANT TO UNNERVE STIVERNE,
IT HASN'T WORKED.

HI, CHAMP. WELCOME.
HOW YOU DOING?

ARRIVING AT THE WBC CONVENTION,
THE CHAMP REMAINS UNCHANGED.

CAREFUL IN HIS CHOICE OF WORDS,
CONFIDENT IN HIS DEMEANOR.

Stiverne:
I'M NOT MUCH OF A TALKER.
I WAS NEVER LIKE THAT.
I WASN'T RAISED LIKE THAT.
RAFAEL.
THIS IS NOT A RAP BATTLE.
THIS IS NOT "JEOPARDY!"
AT THE END OF THE DAY,

WHERE WE SOLVE ALL OF THIS
IS IN THE RING.
...OF A NIGHT.
WHAT'S UP?

THE HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
OF THE WORLD!

I LIKE THAT.
I LIKE THAT.

WHAT'S UP, MIKE?
HEY, BRO.

HOW YOU DOING, MAN?
HOW YOU DOING?
REALLY GOOD.

Narrator:
THE BELT HE HOLDS ADMITS HIM
TO AN EXCLUSIVE FRATERNITY.
NOT JUST CHAMPIONS, BUT LEGENDS.

MEN WHOSE HISTORIES WERE WRITTEN
ON THE BACKS OF FALLEN FOES.

STIVERNE GAINED HIS ENTRANCE
WITH TWO BLOODY BATTLES

AGAINST THE HEAVY-HANDED
CHRIS ARREOLA.

I ALWAYS TOLD MYSELF THAT
I HAD TO FIGHT FOR THE TITLE.
IT'S WHAT I WANTED.

Announcer:
NUMBER 1 VERSUS NUMBER 2

IN THE MAIN EVENT
OF THE EVENING.

Narrator: THREE ROUNDS
INTO THEIR FIRST FIGHT,
STIVERNE DEMONSTRATED HIS POWER,

BREAKING ARREOLA'S NOSE
WITH AN OVERHAND RIGHT --

THE START OF A BRUTAL BEATING
THAT WENT THE DISTANCE.

THE WHOLE FIGHT,
I'M WATCHING HIM.
HE'S LIKE [GASPS]

THE BLOOD IS, LIKE, COMING DOWN,
AND HE CAN'T BREATHE.

AND I THINK I THREW
ALMOST 800 PUNCHES.

AND I WAS LIKE, "OH! I JUST BEAT
THE TOUGHEST GUY OUT THERE."

Narrator:
STIVERNE WAS PROCLAIMED

THE WINNER
BY UNANIMOUS DECISION.

ONLY HIS OPPONENT STILL SEEMED
TO DOUBT HIM.

HE WAS SAYING THE REASON
WHY HE LOST THE FIRST FIGHT
IS BECAUSE I BROKE HIS NOSE,

AND IF HE WAS ME, HE WOULD HAVE
KNOCKED ME OUT OR WHATEVER.

WHEN I HEARD THAT,
I SAID, "OKAY.
THEN WE GOT TO FIGHT.

AND THIS TIME
I GOT TO KNOCK HIM OUT."

Narrator: A YEAR LATER,
THEY MET AGAIN...
[ BELL DINGS ]

...THIS TIME
FOR THE VACANT WBC TITLE.

Stiverne: THE FIRST ROUND,
I WAS SO CONFIDENT.

I WAS JUST WAITING ON HIM
TO COME IN.

AND RIGHT AT THE END OF THE
ROUND, HE CAME IN CARELESS.

AND I CAUGHT HIM WITH A HOOK,
AND HE WOBBLES.
[ LAUGHS ]

AND I REMEMBER I TOLD HIM TO GO
SIT DOWN AND GET SOME WATER.
[ LAUGHS ]
Narrator: BY THE SIXTH,

ARREOLA SUCCUMBED
TO A POWERFUL BARRAGE.
HEY, YOU OKAY?
CAN YOU CONTINUE?

THAT'S IT. THAT'S IT. THAT'S IT.
THAT'S IT, MAN.

I WAS JUST LIKE,
"IS THIS HAPPENING RIGHT NOW?

I'M HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
OF THE WORLD."
AHHH! AHHHH!

Narrator:
AFTER 10 YEARS AS A PRO,

BERMANE STIVERNE IS PREPARING
FOR SOMETHING ENTIRELY NEW...
...ENTERING THE RING

AS THE HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
OF THE WORLD.

Stiverne: I'LL BE ABLE TO GET
MY FIRST DEFENSE AT THE MGM.

THIS FIGHT IS --
THE HYPE IS BIG.
EVERYTHING IS BIGGER.

THEY'RE PROBABLY REALIZING THAT
HE'S NOT WHAT HE SAY HE IS.

Man:
GOOD WORK. [ CLAPS ]

House: THERE'S ONLY ONE WBC
HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMP OF THE WORLD.

AND THERE'S ONLY GONNA
BE ONE FOR A LONG TIME.
VERY LONG TIME.

SO I'M JUST
LETTING Y'ALL KNOW.
WE GOT THIS.
[ EXERCISE BALL HITTING WALL ]
Man: 12.
NICE.
SIX MORE, "D." GOOD.

Narrator: THOUGH WILDER'S KNOWN
FOR MAKING SHORT WORK
OF HIS OPPONENTS,

THIS TIME, HE'S LEAVING
NOTHING TO CHANCE,

PREPARING FOR THE LONGEST AND
TOUGHEST FIGHT OF HIS CAREER.

Man:
SQUEEZE AT THE TOP.

EXPLODE FORWARD. GOOD.
NICE.

FOR A HEAVYWEIGHT
TO BE ABLE TO DO THIS --

IT SHOWS YOU HOW DYNAMIC
AND ATHLETIC DEONTAY REALLY IS.
WHEN WE BREAK CAMP,

HE WILL BE THE BEST-CONDITIONED
HEAVYWEIGHT IN THE WORLD.
GOOD. NICE.
AWESOME. GOOD.
I WORK MY...OFF, MAN.
EVERY DAY, YOU SEE IT.
EVERYBODY GOT THEY OWN STORY.

EVERYBODY GOT THEY HARD TIMES
THEY'VE BEEN THROUGH.
I GOT MINES, TOO.
GROWING UP WAS NO WORRIES,
NO RESPONSIBILITY, JUST MYSELF.

ALL OF A SUDDEN, LIFE CHANGES
JUST LIKE THAT.

THAT'S WHERE MY JOURNEY
REALLY STARTED.

Narrator: WILDER'S PATH
TO THE GYM BEGAN AT 19,

WHEN HE LEARNED HE WAS ABOUT
TO BECOME A FATHER.

HIS DAUGHTER, NAIEYA, WOULD BE
BORN WITH SPINA BIFIDA,

A CONGENITAL DEFORMITY
OF THE SPINAL CORD.

DOCTOR WAS TELLING US
HOW SHE MAY BE IN A WHEELCHAIR,

MAYBE WOULD NEVER BE ABLE
TO WALK.

THEY HAD TO BREAK WHERE HER HIPS
WAS DISLOCATED.

SO THEY HAD TO PUT THE LITTLE
BRACES ON HER HIPS AND STUFF.

Narrator: IN HIS HOPE TO PROVIDE
FOR NAIEYA,
DEONTAY TURNED TO BOXING.

A SPORT HE NEVER TRIED
HE NOW SOUGHT TO MASTER.

HE WAS STEPPING UP TO THE PLATE
TO BE A MAN.
WHEN HE'D GET THROUGH TRAINING,

HE'D COME PICK UP THE BABY
EVERY DAY.

Wilder: BUT MOTIVATED ME
THROUGH SO MUCH, MAN.

IF IT WASN'T HER GOING THROUGH
WHAT SHE'D BEEN THROUGH,

I WOULDN'T HAVE LEARNED
AS I LEARNED, MAN,
THE THINGS THAT I LEARNED.
BOXING WOULD HAVE BEAT ME, MAN.
[ BREATHES DEEPLY ]
WHAT'S UP, BABY?

HEY. YOU HAD A GOOD DAY
AT SCHOOL?
YEAH.
DID YOU READ TODAY?

YES.
WHAT'D YOU READ?

"THE VERY LONG
CHAPTER BOOK."

REALLY?
YES.
YOU KNOW, EACH AND EVERY DAY,

SHE'S STILL LEARNING,
TRYING TO BE SOMEBODY.

YOU KNOW, SHE WANT TO DO
EVERYTHING ON HER OWN.

AND ALL THE SURGERIES SHE DONE
BEEN THROUGH THROUGHOUT LIFE,
MAN, IS JUST...
WE HOLDING EACH OTHER'S HAND.

YOU GOT TO WATCH
FOR THEM CARS, THOUGH.
SHE DONE BEEN THROUGH SO MUCH.

BUT WE DONE
GOT THROUGH IT TOGETHER.
GOT TO BE THANKFUL.

AND NOW THAT I HAVE
THIS OPPORTUNITY,
I CAN'T LET HER DOWN.
[ CHUCKLES ]
[ CHATTER ]
Man: STIR, STIR.

WHAT ARE WE EATING?
WHAT IS IT CALLED?
IT'S CALLED SPAGHETTI.
WAIT A MINUTE.
WITH MEATBALLS.

WAIT A MINUTE.
HOLD ON, HOLD ON.
HUH?

YOU COME OVER FROM HAITI
AND YOU COOK SOME SPAGHETTI?
...YEAH.

SPAGHETTI THE HAITIAN WAY,
PRETTY MUCH.
WE GOOD TO GO?
GOOD TO GO.

LIKE HOME,
WE'RE A LITTLE DIFFERENT.

EVERYBODY GET THEIR...UP
AND GET THEIR OWN FOOD.
IS IT READY?

[ Laughing ]
...YEAH, IT'S READY.
THE MAN GOT 100% RECORD.

ON PAPER, I'M SUPPOSED
TO GET KNOCKED OUT.
I'LL PUT IT LIKE THIS --

IF I WASN'T IN THE GYM DOING
WHAT I'M SUPPOSED TO DO,
I'D BE WORRIED.

LET HIM SEE
WHAT A REAL HEAVYWEIGHT
FEEL LIKE GETTING HIT.

I DON'T THINK HE HAD
TOO MANY OF THOSE.
Man: HERE WE GO.

LORD JESUS, WE COME TO YOU
WITH SOUND MINDS

AND HUMBLE HEARTS TODAY,
VERY HUMBLY.

LORD JESUS, WE ASK YOU
FOR THE MANY BLESSINGS

YOU HAVE GIVEN US
AND YOU ARE ABOUT TO GIVE US.
THERE'S NO PRESSURE ON US.
PRESSURE ON HIM.
HE'S THE GREATEST,

NEXT AMERICAN
HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION.

WE RENEW OUR STRENGTH,
LORD JESUS,

AS WE WORK SO HARD IN TRAINING
CAMP TO GET DEONTAY READY.

HE'S EITHER GREAT
OR HE'S NOT.

NO IN BETWEEN.
WE GONNA FIND OUT.

IN THE NAME OF JESUS,
WE SAY A PRAYER. AMEN.

AMEN!
AMEN!
AMEN!
AMEN!

comments.author: George Garcia

comments.text:
Wilder needs to work on his technique and stamina, otherwise he has all the 
tools to beat both klitschko's. Klitschko's are only good due to there 
height and long reach over their opponents whom are mostly 6'0-6'3. they 
won't have that luck against wilder. It will be interesting to see how they 
fare off against someone who has longer reach than they do and hits just as 
hard if not harder. But the experience of both klitschkos may hurt wilder. 
Fight needs to happen!﻿
comments.author: Yaaé Bamba

has one power punch, so when you see him drop is left shoulder, move right, 
simple. When he has to face a Russian, he will get knocked out. ﻿

comments.author: Ivaylo Mateev

comments.text:
Well it's a small step in the dead heavyweight division I guess. It is what

comments.author: KyoKonKyoChin

comments.text:
+KyoKonKyoChin Are you really suggesting people outside of Germany dont 
know who the Klitschkos are? they are two of the most famous athletes in 
Europe, have fought in front of huge crowds and are clearly the biggest 
stars in Boxing after Floyd and Manny. The Haye/Wlad fight got something 
like 50'000 in attendance and the Povetkin fight got a nice crowd in Moscow 
too. Fury/Chisora pulled good numbers in the UK as well. HW Boxing and 
Boxing in general is perfectly healthy but as usual if Americans arent the 
best at something they either slander it or pretend it doesnt exist. Which 
is why get this BS about Boxing being dead, UFC being bigger, HW division 
sucking compared to the good ol days where near 50 year old Foreman could 
win the title etc.Funny thing is Wlad would quite easily handle the 
majority of champs and contenders from the 90s too.
comments.author: Eggbert

comments.text:
If that's so, how come everyone outside of Germany doesn't know one current 
heavyweight champ? They don't even know if its Vitali or Wladimir. If the 
heavyweight division hasn't been dead for the past 10 years how come it's 
the welterweight division making the most money? When the heavyweight 
division wasn't dead, they were making the most money. Downplay that.
comments.author: KyoKonKyoChin

comments.text:
The HW division isnt dead at all, Americans are just pissed that they arent 
producing top tier HWs these days so try to downplay it by saying "nobody 
cares about the division anymore" "the division isnt as good as it used to 
be" etc etc.
comments.author: Eggbert

comments.text: song 2min30 ?﻿
comments.author: Fabien juventini

comments.text:
Wilder proved that he's is legitimate contender in the heavyweight division 
and he answered all of his critics about his abilities. But, remember fans 
don't expect a Undisputed Championship fight against Klitschko anytime this 
year but if they can keep their belts then maybe next year we might see 
that fight.  ﻿
comments.author: Abel Mehari

comments.text:
Klitschko don't want a piece of this.  Time to retire.  True heavyweight 
star is back since Tyson and Lewis﻿
comments.author: boogiecakes

comments.text:
+boogiecakes Klitschko is 10 years older than Wilder but hes also 10 times 
better and fights in a way that isnt reliant on youth or speed. 

Wouldnt say HW Boxing has lost interest although of course it isnt as big 
as it once was. Wlad/Haye drew a crowd of like 60'000 and was a pretty huge 
fight, Vitali/Chisora and Wlad/Povetkin were pretty big too. Its more that 
Americans dont care so much anymore because they arent producing the best 
HWs these days and in general are getting into MMA more. Safe to say the 
Eastern Euros care though.
comments.author: Eggbert

comments.text:
+Eggbert and there's no way Klitschko's team is gonna want a unification 
bout to lose all those belts and prove that reign is over.  just saying
comments.author: boogiecakes

comments.text:
+Eggbert Klistchko is 10 years older than Wilder.  It's beyond fact that 
the HW division lost interest after Lewis and Tyson left.  Pacquiao, 
Mayweather, and De La Hoya changed boxing as of late.  Look at Klitschko's 
defenses, who big or popular were any of those names?  Fury hasn't even won 
a World Title yet....
comments.author: boogiecakes

comments.text:
+boogiecakes Wilder is a hard hitter but skills trump power, and again, 
Wlad has faced plenty of hard hitters before. I'm not even a big fan of 
either Klitschko but its absolutely insane to suggest Wilder is outshining 
Wlad. Wlad has dominated the HW scene for years and years now and I suspect 
he would be elite in any era of HW boxing. Wilder is pretty entertaining to 
watch but he just doesnt have the skillset to go all the way. I reckon Fury 
would pick him apart quite easily too.
comments.author: Eggbert

comments.text:
+Eggbert you're ignoring the blatant fact of KO ratios. lol.  I suspect 32 
KO's of 33 wins is no Knockout power and every boxer does this?  In all 
honesty, Wider's skills is nothing fancy, but his stature is what provides 
the inertia to hit hard and any pro boxer will tell you strength is 
something you're born with.  It doesn't matter what excuse.  At 33 fights 
Wilder already outshines Klitschko.  Wlad's first challenge for a title was 
against 44 year old Byrd.  Wilder hits harder than Corrie Sanders if you 
know what I mean.. =P
comments.author: boogiecakes

comments.text:
+boogiecakes Pretty much every pro Boxer has knockout power, doesnt matter 
if you cant land cleanly and often. Its not like Wlad hasnt faced heavy 
hitters before.
comments.author: Eggbert

comments.text: +Eggbert you seem to forget there's a thing called Knockout power.
comments.author: boogiecakes

comments.text:
+boogiecakes Lol Wilder aint exactly speedy himself and he is nowhere as 
technical or smart with his range. Honestly Wilder looked pretty meh in 
this performance, nothing special at all. I reckon Fury would beat him 
pretty easily too. Dont get me wrong, it'd be nice to get some new blood in 
the HW division, but Wilder aint the one.

comments.author: Melissa DOnaldson

comments.text:
I like what both of these boxers have accomplished in their respective 
careers thus far and will be 101% behind the winner should he meet-up 
against Wladimir Klitschko. IMHO today's bout boils down to the "football 
player" vs. the "basketball player." The question, to me, then is this: can 
B.S. take D.W.'s best punch? (Yes). Vice Versa: can D.W. stand-up to B.S.'s 
bombs? (No) My heart is with the American but my hard-earned duckets are on 
the Haitian. Best of luck to them both. ﻿
